words: Susie ni n-dagitaarî na ni mû-arimû
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Paul ni-a-kû-on-a TV na ni-a-kû-baac-a n-guo
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.

words: Paul a-rî-on-a TV a-kî-baac-ag-a n-guo
translation: Paul is watching TV; he is ironing his shirts.

words: Susie ni n-dagitaarî îndî ti-mû-toong-û
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.

words: Jen ni-a-gûr-ire n-deremende îndî a-gûr-îr-ire mu-ntû a-ta-iyî
translation: Jen bought sweets but she bought it for a stranger.

words: Paul ti n-dagitaarî ni karani
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Paul ti n-dagitaarî îndî ni karani
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Jen a-ti-a-gûr-a n-deremende a-gûr-ire chokorîti
translation: Jen didn’t buy sweets but she bought chocolate

words: Jen a-ti-a-gûr-a n-deremende îndî a-gûr-ire chokorîti
translation: Jen didn’t buy sweets but she bought chocolate

words: Ansa ni-wa wigue î-rî A kana B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.
comment: with 2 complete sentences sounds very unnatural

words: Ansa î-a kî-ûria kî-kî ni-wa wigue î-rî A kana B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.
comment: with 2 complete sentences sounds very unnatural

words: Gatî ka Paûrû na Njoni, û-mwe wa-o ni n-dagitarî
glosses: Between of Paul and John, 1-one conn-them cop 9-doctor
translation: Between Paul and John, one of them is a doctor.

words: Ni-wa wigue ni-tig-ire thimû û-bicii-ni kana ni-te-ire n-jiraa-ni
translation: It may be that I left the phone in the office or I lost it on the way.

words: Njoni ni n-dagitarî kana mû-andîk-i
translation: John is a doctor or a writer.

words: Njoni ni-wa wigue a-rî ni n-dagitarî mû-andîk-i kana bi-onthe
translation: John might be a doctor, a writer or both.

words: Û-tig-ire thimû û-biciini kana û-tig-ire m-baci-ni
translation: Lit: You left your phone in the office or you left it on the bus?

words: Ni Nakumatt î-ûmba kû-îgua î-kî-end-ag-i-a roiko kana ni Mathai
glosses: Foc Nakumatt 9-MOD 15-be 9-?-sell-hab-ic-fv royco or foc Mathai
translation: Is it Nakumatt that may be selling Royco or Mathaî?

words: Paûri ti n-dagitarî na ti naasi
translation: Lit: Paul is not a doctor and not a nurse.

words: Maako a-ti-a-gûr-a aîcikirimu na a-ti-a-neenk-îr-a mî-aragina î-o
translation: Mark didn’t buy ice cream and didn’t give it to his sister.

words: Paûru ni-wa a-rî-e cupcake kana cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or a cookie.

words: Susie ti n-dagitarî na ti mu-ugia
translation: Susie is not a doctor and not a runner.

words: Susie ni n-dagitaarî ni mû-arimû
translation: Susie is a doctor, she is a teacher.
comment: needs “na”, without it, it sounds like you are correcting yourself

words: Susie i ndagitaarî na n’wa wîgue i mwarimû
translation: Susie is a doctor and she might be a teacher.
comment: this would mean that she could be both ( n’wa wîgue ~ possibility)

words: Susie n’wa wîgue i ndagitaarî kana i mwarimû
translation: Susie might be a doctor or a teacher.

words: Susie ti ndagitaarî na ti mwarimû
translation: Susie is not a doctor and not a teacher.

words: Susie ni n-dagitaarî ti-mû-toong-û
translation: Susie is a doctor, she is not rich.

words: Jen ni-a-gûr-ire n-deremende a-gûr-îr-ire mu-ntû a-ta-iyî
translation: Jen bought sweets, she bought it for a stranger.

words: Paurû i ndagitarî, Njoni i ndagitarî
glosses: Paul foc doctor, John foc doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor, John is a doctor.

words: Paurû i ndagitarî kana Njoni i ndagitarî
glosses: Paul foc doctor or John foc doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: this could be correct depending on how we play the game

words: Ndagitaarî i Paûrû kana Njoni.
translation: The doctor is Paul or John.

words: Paurû kana Njoni i ndagitarî
translation: Paul or John is a doctor.

words: N’wa wîgue Njoni kana Paûrû i ndagîtaarî
glosses: MOD John or Paul foc doctor
translation: Maybe John or Paul is a doctor.

words: Njoni n’wa wigue i ndagitarî kana Njoni n’wa wigue i mwandîki
glosses: John MOD foc doctor or John MOD foc writer
translation: John might be a doctor or John might be a writer.

words: Ntigire thimû ûbiciini kana nteere njîraani
translation: I left the phone in the office or lost it on the way
comment: sounds like you are certain that you left it in the office

words: N’wa wigue ntigire thimû ûbiciini nteere njîraani
translation: Maybe I left the phone in the office, I lost it on the way.

words: Njoni ni n-dagitarî mû-andîk-i
translation: John is a doctor, a writer.

words: Gatî ka ûndagitaarî na wandîki, îmwe ya-ci-o n’-yo Njoni arutaga
glosses: Between 12-of doctorship and writership, one of-10-them is-what John does
translation: Between doctorship and writership, John does one of them.

words: gatî ka mbaci na ûbici, amwe a-gu n’oo n-tigire thimû.
glosses: between of bus and office,16-one 16-dem foc-pron (there) 1sg.sm-left phone
translation: Between the bus and the office, it is one of the places that I left the phone.

words: gatî ka mbaci na ûbici, i kû ûtigire thimû.
glosses: between of bus and office where 2sg.sm-left phone
translation: Between the bus and the office, where did you leave the phone?

words: Paûrû ti n-dagitarî, ti naasi
translation: Paul is not a doctor, not a nurse.
comment: again, this sounds like correction without a connector

words: Paurû n-wa arîe cupcake kana Paurû n-wa arîe cookie
glosses: Paul MOD eat cupcake or Paul MOD eat cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or Paul can eat a cookie.
comment: again, this sounds repetitive with the full clauses

words: Gatî ka cupcake na cookie, Paûrû n’wa arîe kî-mwe gî-a-bi-o
glosses: Between of cupcake and cookie, Paul MOD eat 7-one 7-conn-8-pron
translation: Between a cupcake and a cookie, Paul can eat one of them.
